= Terminology = 

window size - the number of times a node needs to wakeup inorder to make a decision about
changing the number of connections. 
 
process - increase or decrease the number of connections to increase greater download bandwidth.

wakeup - modify the set of upload peers to attract better download peers. 

moving average - 

relative window size - each node gets assigned to an individual window size base on the square root of its upload capacity.

dynamic window size - the window size is adjusted base on the number of uploads. (N + 5 - upload connections) Where N is the number of nodes.

upload capacity - the upload speed of a node from an empirical tail-heavy distribution.

= P2P Protocols = 

1)Original Bittorrent Protocol - fix the number of upload connections to 5 and disable the decision process. 

2)Improved Bittorrent Protocol - square root of upload capacity and disable decision process.
  
3)Random Number of Initial Connections  

4)Fully connected number of connections
